intro: Malachra rudis, commonly known as the slender malachra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers that bloom during the dry season. Malachra rudis is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
